sentences.en: And she felt aggrieved and insulted.
sentences.cn: 玛丽大为不满,一肚子都是委屈.

sentences.en: Carrie was ashamed, and Drouet aggrieved.
sentences.cn: 嘉莉感到羞愧, 杜洛埃感到委屈.

sentences.en: He felt aggrieved at not being chosen for the team.
sentences.cn: 他因没被选到队里感到愤愤不平.

sentences.en: He was aggrieved at the insult from his friend.
sentences.cn: 他因受朋友的侮辱而感到苦恼.

sentences.en: His duty is to assist the aggrieved person inasmuch as he is able.
sentences.cn: 他的责任是尽他所能帮助受冤屈的人.

sentences.en: His tone was by turns angry and aggrieved.
sentences.cn: 他的语气时而透着愤怒，时而流露出哀怨。

sentences.en: I am aggrieved to find that someone have used my toothbrush.
sentences.cn: 我发现有人用过我的牙刷,我很不高兴.

sentences.en: I really feel aggrieved at this sort of thing.
sentences.cn: 我真为这种事感到委屈。

sentences.en: Likes to listen to you, and obedient, the aggrieved also willingly.
sentences.cn: 喜欢听你说话, 并且听话, 受委屈也心甘情愿.

sentences.en: Persons aggrieved by refusal of an application can normally secure judicial review of the decision.
sentences.cn: 因申请遭到拒绝而受到侵害的人通常能够获得拒绝决定者的司法检查.

sentences.en: She is the aggrieved person whose fiance & 1 & did not show up for their wedding.
sentences.cn: 她很委屈,她的 未婚夫 未出现在他们的婚礼上.

sentences.en: The aggrieved parties ought to perform their own investigation, the University argues.
sentences.cn: 受害的当事人应当履行自己的调查, 该大学辩称.

sentences.en: the aggrieved party (=  the person who has suffered  )
The army, over - stretched and taking heavy casualties in Afghanistan, feels understandably aggrieved.
sentences.cn: 身疲力竭的军队在阿富汗遭遇了大量人员伤亡, 他们感到委屈也可以理解.

sentences.en: There is no need to look so aggrieved.
They were aggrieved by oppression and extortion.
sentences.cn: 他们遭受压迫与榨取的痛苦.

words.tran_cn: 受委屈的，愤愤不平的；权利受到不法侵害的
侵害，伤害（aggrieve的过去分词形式）；使悲痛

trans.tran_cn: 愤愤不平的，受委屈的，悲痛的，<律>（在合法权利方面）受侵害的
trans.tran_en: having suffered as a result of the illegal actions of someone else

trans.tran_cn: 令委屈，令苦恼，侵害( aggrieve的过去式)，令委屈，令苦恼，侵害( aggrieve的过去式和过去分词)
